discussion.content: Horizontal and vertical are containers where you can actually add sheets. Answer seems to be right.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a blank dashboard.

You want to add two sheets to the dashboard. The sheets must support the Show/Hide button.

To which two objects can you add the sheets? Click the two appropriate Options in the Answer Area.

//IMG//

discussion.content: Sheets is correct. Permission is restricted at workbook level. There are two dashboards in the workbook. Permissions settings are applied to all worksheets and dashboards in the workbook. Therefore to prevent Dashboard2 from showing on Tableau Server/Cloud, don't upload Dashboard2, and that is configured at Sheets.
Answer is Permissions. You can set default permissions to allow no access or restricted access to a workbook.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a workbook that contains two dashboards named Dashboard1 and Dashboard2.

You want to share Dashboard2 with the users in your organization. The users must NOT have access to Dashboard2.

Which setting should you configure when you publish the workbook? (Click the appropriate Option in the Answer Area.)

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Percent of Total
A is correct. % of total in quick table calculation.

Selected Answer: A
B is incorrect. since we need all the fields for all tables therefore we should use a full outer and not the left one. The left only takes the matching fields so the second table wont have the fields indicated because they are not similar

questions.question_text:
You have two tables named EmployeeInfo and DepartmentInfo. EmployeeInfo contains four fields named Full Name, Department ID, Start Date, and Salary. DepartmenIinfo contains four fields named Department Name, Size, Department ID, and VP.

You want to combine the tables to meet the following requirements:

• Each record in EmployeeInfo must be retained in the combined table.
• The records must contain the Department Name, Size, and VP fields.
• Every record must have a full name.

Which type of join should you use?

You are creating a new dashboard.

You need to add a button to the dashboard that allows users to export the dashboard as an image.

Which type of object should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
By using an extension, you can provide a seamless and user-friendly way for your audience to capture and share the insights presented in your Tableau dashboard.
